item.title: Arfi add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "There are no innocents. There are, however, different degrees of responsibility." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Arfi add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "Salander's fingers emerged like something dead from beneath the earth. Had there been any human watching, he would probably have reacted like the fox. He was gone like a shot." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Arfi add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "What she had realised was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "For in every adult there dwells the child that was, and in every child there lies the adult that will be." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "Being scared isn't the problem. It's not running away that's the hard part." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "He would talk to them of stories and books, and explain to them how stories wanted to be told and books wanted to be read, and how everything that they ever needed to know about life and the land of which he wrote, or about any land or realm that they could imagine, was contained in books. And some of the children understood, and some did not." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description:
". . . For a lifetime was but a moment in that place, and each man dreams his own heaven.
And in the darkness David closed his eyes, as all that was lost was found again." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "I believe in those whom I love and trust. All else is foolishness. This god is as empty as his church. His followers choose to attribute all of their good fortune to him, but when he ignores their pleas or leaves them to suffer, they say only that he ignores their pleas or leaves them to suffer, they say only that he is beyond their understanding and abandon themselves to his will. What kind of god is that?" -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "The nature of compassion isn't coming to terms with your own suffering and applying it to others: It's knowing that other folks around you suffer and, no matter what happens to you, no matter how lucky or unlucky you are, they keep suffering. And if you can do something about that, then you do it, and you do it without whining or waving your own fuckin' cross for the world to see. You do it because it's the right thing to do." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "You had evil inside you, and you indulged it. Men will always indulge it." -- John Connolly

item.title: Arfi add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "Each man dreams his own heaven." -- John Connolly
